clinical_study.brief_title: the Accuracy and Safety of Renal Artery Contrast-enhanced Magnetic Resonance Imaging With Polysaccharide Superparamagnetic Iron Oxide Nanoparticle
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study of Domestic Polysaccharide Superparamagnetic Iron Oxide Nanoparticle Injection for Renal Artery Contrast-enhanced Magnetic Resonance Imaging

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

collaborator.agency: School of Biological Science and Medical Engineering, Southeast University
School of Biomedical Engineering and Information, Nanjing Medical University
Chia Tai Tianqing Pharmaceutical Group Co., Ltd.

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a single-center, prospective, controlled and diagnostic clinical trial to explore the effectiveness and safety of domestic polysaccharide superparamagnetic iron oxide injection for contrast-enhanced renal artery magnetic resonance. This study will enroll 40 patients scheduled for renal arteriography in China.The investigators will record the baseline data of patients after admission.Patients will receive contrast-enhanced renal artery magnetic resonance with polysaccharide superparamagnetic iron oxide nanoparticle to assess renal artery stenosis.The related laboratory indexes will be reviewed at 72 h after Magnetic Resonance Imaging ,and then patients will receive renal angiography . The indexes were reexamined at 1 month and 3 months after magnetic resonance imaging. The investigators will Record all clinical adverse events. In order to evaluate the safety of polysaccharide superparamagnetic iron oxide nanoparticle, patients will detect iron levels in peripheral and tissue before and after the examination.The investigators will Record all clinical adverse events in this study.

primary_outcome.measure: the degree of renal artery stenosis
primary_outcome.description: Degree of renal artery stenosis assessed by Magnetic Resonance Imaging

primary_outcome.measure: the degree of renal artery stenosis
primary_outcome.description: Degree of renal artery stenosis assessed by renal artery angiography
hemoglobin examination of patients before and after examination to evaluate anemia.
serum creatinine examination of patients before and after examination to evaluate kidney function.
Urine routine examination of patients before and after examination to evaluate kidney function.
24-hour urine biochemistry examination of patients before and after examination to evaluate kidney function.
Retinol binding protein examination of patients before and after examination to evaluate kidney function.
Neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin examination of patients before and after examination to evaluate kidney function.
Determination of serum iron before and after MRA to evaluate the changes of iron content in peripheral blood.
Determination of serum ferritin before and after MRA to evaluate the changes of iron content in peripheral blood.
Determination of serum transferrin before and after MRA to evaluate the changes of iron content in peripheral blood.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of iron content in tissues between different time points
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of tissue iron content by T1W MRI before and after MRA.

arm_group.description: Patients will receive contrast-enhanced renal artery magnetic resonance with polysaccharide superparamagnetic iron oxide nanoparticle before renal angiography.

intervention.intervention_name: domestic polysaccharide superparamagnetic iron oxide nanoparticle
intervention.description: Patients will receive contrast-enhanced renal artery magnetic resonance with polysaccharide superparamagnetic iron oxide nanoparticle before renal angiography.Patients received intravenous polysaccharide superparamagnetic iron oxide nanoparticle before magnetic resonance imaging.

facility.name: First Affiliated Hospital of Nanjing Medical University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University
responsible_party.investigator_title: Dr., MD, Ph.D, Director of CCU Ward

clinical_study.keyword: Ultrasmall Superparamagnetic Particles of Iron Oxide
